pullRequest.title: Support overriding prefix of @ConfigProperties at the injection point

beforeCommit.message:
Support overriding prefix of @ConfigProperties at the injection point

Resolves #9136

afterCommit.message:
Support overriding prefix of @ConfigProperties at the injection point

Resolves #9136

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            <1> At this injection point `greetingConfiguration` with use the `greeting` prefix since that is what has been defined on `@ConfigProperties`.
          
          
            
            <1> At this injection point `greetingConfiguration` will use the `greeting` prefix since that is what has been defined on `@ConfigProperties`.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -313,6 +313,42 @@ If the validation fails with the given configuration, the application will fail
 In the case of an interface being annotated with `@ConfigProperties`, the interface is allowed to extend other interfaces and methods from
 the entire interface hierarchy are used to bind properties.
 
+=== Using same ConfigProperties with different prefixes
+
+Quarkus also supports allows the use of the same `@ConfigProperties` object with different prefixes for each injection point using the `io.quarkus.arc.config.@ConfigPrefix` annotation.
+Say for example that `GreetingConfiguration` from above needs to be used for both the `greeting` prefix and the `other` prefix.
+In that case the code would look like so:
+
+`GreetingConfiguration.java`
+[source,java]
+----
+@ConfigProperties(prefix = "greeting")
+public class GreetingConfiguration {
+
+    @Size(min = 20)
+    public String message;
+    public String suffix = "!";
+
+}
+----
+
+`SomeBean.java`
+[source,java]
+----
+@ApplicationScoped
+public class SomeBean {
+
+    @Inject <1>
+    GreetingConfiguration greetingConfiguration;
+
+    @ConfigPrefix("other") <2>
+    GreetingConfiguration otherConfiguration;
+
+}
+----
+<1> At this injection point `greetingConfiguration` with use the `greeting` prefix since that is what has been defined on `@ConfigProperties`.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            <2> At this injection point `otherConfiguration` with use the `other` prefix from `@ConfigPrefix`. Notice that in this case `@Inject` is not required.
          
          
            
            <2> At this injection point `otherConfiguration` will use the `other` prefix from `@ConfigPrefix`. Notice that in this case `@Inject` is not required.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -313,6 +313,42 @@ If the validation fails with the given configuration, the application will fail
 In the case of an interface being annotated with `@ConfigProperties`, the interface is allowed to extend other interfaces and methods from
 the entire interface hierarchy are used to bind properties.
 
+=== Using same ConfigProperties with different prefixes
+
+Quarkus also supports allows the use of the same `@ConfigProperties` object with different prefixes for each injection point using the `io.quarkus.arc.config.@ConfigPrefix` annotation.
+Say for example that `GreetingConfiguration` from above needs to be used for both the `greeting` prefix and the `other` prefix.
+In that case the code would look like so:
+
+`GreetingConfiguration.java`
+[source,java]
+----
+@ConfigProperties(prefix = "greeting")
+public class GreetingConfiguration {
+
+    @Size(min = 20)
+    public String message;
+    public String suffix = "!";
+
+}
+----
+
+`SomeBean.java`
+[source,java]
+----
+@ApplicationScoped
+public class SomeBean {
+
+    @Inject <1>
+    GreetingConfiguration greetingConfiguration;
+
+    @ConfigPrefix("other") <2>
+    GreetingConfiguration otherConfiguration;
+
+}
+----
+<1> At this injection point `greetingConfiguration` with use the `greeting` prefix since that is what has been defined on `@ConfigProperties`.
+<2> At this injection point `otherConfiguration` with use the `other` prefix from `@ConfigPrefix`. Notice that in this case `@Inject` is not required.

afterCommit.message:
Support overriding prefix of @ConfigProperties at the injection point

Resolves #9136

Co-authored-by: Manyanda Chitimbo <manyanda.chitimbo@gmail.com>

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -313,6 +313,42 @@ If the validation fails with the given configuration, the application will fail
 In the case of an interface being annotated with `@ConfigProperties`, the interface is allowed to extend other interfaces and methods from
 the entire interface hierarchy are used to bind properties.
 
+=== Using same ConfigProperties with different prefixes
+
+Quarkus also supports allows the use of the same `@ConfigProperties` object with different prefixes for each injection point using the `io.quarkus.arc.config.@ConfigPrefix` annotation.

nodes.bodyText: This annotation transformer is redundant - ConfigPrefix is a qualifier and so it should be handled by io.quarkus.arc.deployment.AutoInjectFieldProcessor.
There is no need to use the getters for @Singleton beans - you could save quite a few lines of code ;-).

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            <2> At this injection point `otherConfiguration` will use the `other` prefix from `@ConfigPrefix`. Notice that in this case `@Inject` is not required.
          
          
            
            <2> At this injection point `otherConfiguration` will use the `other` prefix from `@ConfigPrefix` instead of the `greeting` prefix. Notice that in this case `@Inject` is not required.
          
      
    
    
  

? I think that's what you intented to do when you talked about it.
TBH, I'm wondering if we should concatenate the prefixes instead of replacing them? I haven't looked at the implementation so it might be what you did.

@@ -313,6 +313,42 @@ If the validation fails with the given configuration, the application will fail

+Say for example that `GreetingConfiguration` from above needs to be used for both the `greeting` prefix and the `other` prefix.
+In that case the code would look like so:

commit.message:
Support overriding prefix of @ConfigProperties at the injection point

Resolves #9136

Co-authored-by: Manyanda Chitimbo <manyanda.chitimbo@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Martin Kouba <mkouba@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Guillaume Smet <guillaume.smet@gmail.com>
